Name: Unparalleled Mechascout
Description: Help Zeon find all four Mechascout parts and complete the statue
QuestDesc: Help Zeon find all four Mechascout parts and complete the statue

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a supplies package from the Academy...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I should bring it back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Troubled Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That little rascal... What's to be done...

Options.PlotLineKey: Excuse me. You got any arm parts for a Mechascout?

Dialogues.Speaker: Troubled Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Parts... I find I am in no mood for business today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Troubled Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My son, that little scamp, has grown a picky tongue! He throws fits, refusing to eat our food.

Dialogues.Speaker: Troubled Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A growing lad needs his food. Why won't he eat?

Options.PlotLineKey: He got tired of all the good food?
Had too many snacks before his meal?

Dialogues.Speaker: Troubled Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got tired of them... You have a point!

Dialogues.Speaker: Troubled Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We make our best dishes for him, his mother and I! Yet he turns his head away. Bored of our food, he must be!

Dialogues.Speaker: Troubled Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Too many snacks... You have a point!

Dialogues.Speaker: Troubled Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With so many tasty treats lying around, of course he doesn't appreciate his meals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Troubled Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I've heard that food in your Academy halls has... a unique flavor. True, this tale? A hand you could lend?

Dialogues.Speaker: Troubled Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bring me the Academy's most iconic food, and these arm parts are yours! It's time I showed my boy the diversity this world has to offer!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The quintessential Academy food... Is it the "Complete Nutrition Squeezy Jelly" or the "Instant Wakeup Energy Gel Sachet"?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I'll get it ready for the trade.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to his marked location, they should be around here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tired Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zeon sent you to pick up the materials, correct?

Dialogues.Speaker: Tired Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He has no idea how much trouble this was... It's technically decommissioned, but getting what he asked for was a nightmare.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tired Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Listen, this is a classified component. Do not open the case. Don't let anyone see it. Or we'll all be in deep trouble.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tired Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And when you see him? Give him an earful for me, will you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We did it! We really did it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, look! It's moving! It's standing on its own!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks to your help, this is my first fully functional mech assembly! We did it!

Options.PlotLineKey: Oh, so this is a first...
Getting this far is impressive in itself.

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So this is the purpose for your scavenging? A walking heap of scrap, I see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Outcast Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some of those parts were stolen from our camp.

Dialogues.Speaker: Outcast Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our thanks you have, for saving us the work. We will sell the whole machine! A finer price it will bring!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No! No one lays a finger on my mech! It's just a child!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mechascout (?)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Detected... Hostile intent. Initiating... Defense Protocol.

Dialogues.Speaker: Outcast Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What the...! It moves?? Is it not a failed creation?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mechascout (?)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Warning... Evacuate immediately. Countdown initiated... 5... 4...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mechascout (?)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...1. Commencing attack.

Dialogues.Speaker: Outcast Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did it jump from 5 to 1?! That's not fair—

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It... activated self-destruct.

Dialogues.Speaker: Outcast Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh. That pile of bolts gave me a start!

Dialogues.Speaker: Outcast Leader
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now it's blown to smithereens! Let's see what shields you now—

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello? I'm still here. Did you forget about me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Aren't you... {PlayerName} from the Academy? You want this? No, no! Finders keepers, alright? Don't even think about taking it!

Options.PlotLineKey: Are professors scavenging for parts now?
Who said I was going to steal it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Scavenging?! How dare you call the work of a machine enthusiast scavenging!?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, you're not a fellow enthusiast... Phew, you had me worried for a second.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you can see, everything here is already officially decommissioned. This big guy is now just a pile of cold, useless metal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But "decommissioned" shouldn't be its end. Since the wiping of its data core is already an announcement of its death, we are now free from all the rules!

Options.PlotLineKey: Sounds like something a mad scientist would say.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: R-really? I thought that line was rather cool. I've been saving it, haha.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To be honest, I'm from the Agronomy Wing, but I've always dreamed of joining the Multi-Turret Club and designing my own mechs... I just, well, didn't pass their assessment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now, I've just had a wave of inspiration. This may be my chance to follow my dream and rehaul this mech. Just imagine it standing on its own feet again!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will create a Mechascout the likes of which no one has ever seen! So... will you help me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, I'll give you a satisfying reward for your trouble!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Its torso is pretty much intact. If we can just find the right parts, we can start the modifications right away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Actually, I ordered a batch of leg parts out of my own pocket a few days ago, but they were stolen by Outcasts. What if we tried to get them back?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Never mind the details. We shouldn't let existing designs limit ourselves. We must break free from all conventions!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Outcast's camp is no joke. You should create a distraction, then sneak in to grab the parts. Remember, safety first!

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, I can handle myself pretty well.
Just wait for the good news!

Dialogues.Speaker: Troubled Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This taste that robs a person of their appetite... this feeling of science... Yes, this is it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Troubled Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll make good use of this "generous gift." May it cure my boy's finicky ways.

Dialogues.Speaker: Troubled Merchant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The parts are yours, as was promised. My thanks to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Haughty Student
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You actually... smashed all of them?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Haughty Student
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That kind of god-tier driving, you must be a legend! Are you the one they call the "Startorch Rider"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Short-tempered Student
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You won, so the parts are yours. But on one condition!

Dialogues.Speaker: Short-tempered Student
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I'd like to have your contact info. If we get a chance, let's go racing together!

Dialogues.Speaker: Haughty Student
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me too! You have to come to our next race!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh my, the modifications turned out even better than I imagined! I feel confident that we can finish this now!

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's see how it works first...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You get it! I specifically chose parts from different sources to maximize performance diversity!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, stop! I just made use of existing resources. But thank you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that it can stand on its own two feet, it's time to give it a pair of strong arms!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's a merchant at a Roya camp who specializes in recycling damaged parts from the Academy's Mechascouts. He'll definitely have what we need.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, whatever he charges, I'll mark it in the expenses!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're finally back! How did it go? Did you find the parts?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No question about it! They were made for my Mechascout! I'll install them right away!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am halfway through the assembly process. Victory is in sight!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, the next step is crucial. I'm planning to install a more powerful weapon system, true to the Multi-Turret Club's philosophy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's an old Huanglong saying, something like, "If you want to do a job well, you first need a sharp weapon."

Options.PlotLineKey: "If a workman wishes to do a good job, he must first sharpen his tools."

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly! That's the one! I didn't know you were so familiar with Huanglong culture.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can't have "Multi-Turrets" without "guns," eh? Eh?! I've been dying to install an electromagnetic railgun on a Mechascout.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But such weapons aren't particularly easy to find. The Expedition Team has several decommissioned Spacetrek Explorers rusting out in the wild. I've marked their locations on your map. Mind helping me track them down?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oooh, these are the Mechascout arms of my dreams! So much power! I can feel the potential!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch as I install these parts! Hmm, the connection ports might not be a perfect fit...

Options.PlotLineKey: You can't just force it in!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Minor issues! Every problem has a solution. Don't worry!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Overwhelmed with joy, Zeon assembles the electromagnetic railgun in record time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After all these years, this is the closest I've come to fulfilling my dream!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just one final step! We need a strong enough power source, or in simple terms, the head, and then it'll be finished!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I called in a favor from a colleague in the field. He found the perfect head unit. Could you make one last trip and bring it back?

Options.PlotLineKey: It's not something dangerous, is it?
It won't blow up on the way back, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Absolutely not! I asked him to store it inside a specialized protective container. Safety guaranteed!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zeon
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The address has been sent to your Terminal. Make haste, and travel safe!
